name: conserve
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to keep and protect something from damage, change, or waste: To conserve electricity, we are cutting down on our heating. The nationalists are very eager to conserve their customs and language. I'm not being lazy - I'm just conserving my energy/strength for later. Synonym
husband formal

to keep and protect from waste, loss, or damage; preserve: In order to conserve fuel, they put in extra insulation.
